content.description: The relationship between carbon dioxide emissions and fuel efficiency of a certain car can be modeled by the least-squares regression equation <math alttext="the natural log of y hat, equals 7 minus 0.045 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mover><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.045</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the fuel efficiency, in miles per gallon, and <math alttext="y hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></math> represents the predicted carbon dioxide emissions, in grams per mile.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the predicted carbon dioxide emissions, in grams per mile, for a car of this type with a fuel efficiency of 20 miles per gallon?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
